description: This course is an introduction to financial accounting. The preparation and use of financial statements is examined. The accounting cycle, assets and liabilities reporting, is discussed.
title: Introduction to Financial Accounting
prerequisites: Not open to students in Arts and Business, Environment and Business, Science and Business or Human Resources Management.
subject: AFM

description: This course is an introduction to the preparation and use of accounting information for management decision-making and reporting. Cost behaviour, cost accumulation systems and short and long-term decision models are discussed.

subject: AFM

description: This course describes the role of finance in the modern global economy and introduces some basic principles of financial decision-making.

subject: AFM

description: This course is designed for non-accountants who will use accounting information for planning, control and decision making.

subject: AFM

description: The functional areas of business: finance, personnel administration, production, marketing, and accounting are examined within differing organizational structures. subject: AFM

description: This course discusses auditing and taxation concepts as they relate to professional accounting and management.

subject: AFM

subject: AFM

subject: AFM

subject: AFM

description: This course considers various aspects of information from a business and problem-solving perspective. subject: AFM

description: This is the first in a two-course sequence that introduces the theory of financial decision-making within firms. Topics include capital budgeting, cost of capital, security issuance, capital structure, payout policy and dividends, short term finance, and risk management, among others.

notes: [Note: Graded on a credit/no credit basis.]
